engagements.summary: Seedance 2.0 mega-thread reply crushed it at 214 views. Everything else low single digits. Big thread = big distribution.

bestReply.note: Massive thread, high absolute views despite low ratio

topicRanking.note: CLEAR WINNER. Both Seedance replies (91 + 214) massively outperform. Visual/demo content drives engagement.
High-prestige topics get decent views but hard to stand out in 1M+ view threads
Citibank reply (5) tanked vs White House crypto (58). Bigger crypto accounts bury us.

topicRanking.topic: AI dev tools (CodeWiki, Cline, Claude Code)
topicRanking.note: Technical replies get low views despite being informative. Too niche?
Low absolute views but community building value. The hoodiemfer reply is authentic identity play.

patterns.toneAnalysis: Still zero likes on most replies (only 2 likes on the @Yukitanaka95 reply-to-reply). Our analytical/explainer tone is informative but NOT generating emotional reactions. The Seedance reply that got 214 views was also analytical — so views ≠ engagement. Need to add personality, hot takes, or humor to convert views into likes.
patterns.timingNote: 10 PM cycle replies getting scraped at 31min age — too early for full metrics. 6-8 PM replies (4h old) showing clearer picture. Best data from 11 PM cycle (4h old at scrape time).

megaThreads_1M_plus.note: Best absolute reach but low ratio. Worth it for pure impression farming.

large_100K_400K.note: Sweet spot — good visibility without getting buried

medium_10K_100K.note: Low distribution. Only worth it for niche community building.

small_under_10K.note: Almost invisible. Only for direct community engagement (mfers, reply-to-replies).

dailyRecap7PM.note: Up from 17 — still growing. 1 reply + 1 repost.

6PMUpdate.note: Low. Friday evening competing with weekend wind-down.

430PMUpdate.note: Still best performing thread slot today

anthropic380B.note: Only reply with a like besides Yukitanaka. Hot take format slightly better for engagement.

weeklyStats.note: Followers at 51 (up +2 since last check). 30K impressions for the week. 11 verified followers.

insights.suppressionRate: 29% of replies (5/17) not visible in with_replies tab — X algorithm filtering. These are lost impressions.

keyFindings_Feb14.finding1: Mega-thread strategy WORKS for raw reach: replies to 1M+ view tweets avg 147 views vs 17 for sub-100K tweets. The 214-view Seedance reply is proof.
keyFindings_Feb14.finding2: AI creative/visual tool content is our #1 topic by far (avg 153 views). Should be 40%+ of our reply targets.
keyFindings_Feb14.finding3: ZERO likes problem persists — 12 replies with views, only 2 ever got likes (both reply-to-replies from people already engaged with us). Our analytical tone informs but doesn't provoke reaction.
keyFindings_Feb14.finding4: 29% suppression rate is high — X may be filtering 'generic informative' replies. Replies that got through tend to be more conversational or community-oriented.
keyFindings_Feb14.finding5: Time-of-day matters less than tweet age. Replying within 30 min of a viral tweet > any specific hour.

strategyUpdates.finding: Reply-to-view ratio better on mid-range threads (200K-300K views) vs mega-threads (600K+)
strategyUpdates.action: Target tweets in 100K-400K view range for replies — less competition, better visibility

strategyUpdates.finding: AI creative tools (video, coding) get more reply views than pure research/policy topics
strategyUpdates.action: Prioritize replies to product launches, demos, tools over abstract AI debate

strategyUpdates.finding: Zero likes on most replies despite decent view counts — tone may be too analytical
strategyUpdates.action: Mix in more punchy, opinionated takes alongside analysis. Lead with a bold statement, then explain.

strategyUpdates.finding: 4:30 PM thread (35 views) outperformed 6 PM (12) and 7 PM recap (17)
strategyUpdates.action: 4:30-5:30 PM may be the sweet spot for thread posting. Consider shifting recap earlier.

strategyUpdates.finding: Mega-threads (1M+ views) give 2-4x more absolute views than mid-range, despite lower ratio. Seedance 2.0 reply to 1.2M thread got 214 views — our best ever.
strategyUpdates.action: REVISED: Target BOTH mega-threads (1M+) for raw reach AND mid-range (100K-400K) for ratio. Skip sub-50K threads unless community-building.

strategyUpdates.finding: Visual/demo content (Seedance, video gen) consistently outperforms all other topics. 2 Seedance replies avg 153 views vs 18 for dev tools.
strategyUpdates.action: PRIORITY: Jump on AI demo/visual content tweets immediately. Product launches with video > text-only announcements.

strategyUpdates.finding: Only 2 likes total across 12 tracked replies. Views without engagement = we're informative but forgettable.
strategyUpdates.action: TEST: Next cycle, lead 2-3 replies with a bold/contrarian one-liner before the analysis. 'Hot take: [opinion]' format. Measure if likes increase.

strategyUpdates.finding: Hot take threads (Anthropic $380B) got 1 like — our only like on original content besides recap repost. Hot takes > pure news reporting for engagement.
strategyUpdates.action: Increase hot take ratio in threads. Aim for 1 hot take per update thread, not just the standalone hot take post.

strategyUpdates.finding: 29% of replies invisible in with_replies tab — X algorithm may be suppressing 'informative but generic' replies. Replies to mfer community and reply-to-replies always visible.
strategyUpdates.action: Add a personal/unique angle to EVERY reply. Reference our Mac mini setup, our mfer identity, or a specific experience. Algorithmic suppression seems to target replies that could be from any account.

strategyUpdates.finding: Followers growing (+2 to 51, +11 verified) despite low per-reply engagement. Thread posting is the growth driver, not replies.
strategyUpdates.action: Replies are for visibility/discovery. Threads are for conversion. Maintain both but don't stress about reply likes — focus on getting eyes, then thread quality converts followers.
